knimeNode.name: Row Filter
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows filtering of datarows by certain criteria, such as row ID, attribute value, and row number range.

fullDescription.intro: The node allows for row filtering according to certain criteria. It can include or exclude: certain ranges (by row number), rows with a certain row ID, and rows with a certain value in a selectable column (attribute). Below are the steps on how to configure the node in its configuration dialog.

option.name: In- or exclude rows by criteria

fullDescription.option: You must first select which criteria should be used for filtering from the left-hand side. Also choose whether to include or exclude rows according to the selected criteria. Depending on the choice, you will then have to adjust the filter parameters in the right-hand panel.

If filter by attribute value is selected, select the name of the column whose value should be matched. Then, either enter a regular expression for string matching, or a value range, for range filtering. When using a regular expression, you can set a checkmark, if you want a case sensitive match to be made. If a range is specified, you specify only one boundary, the other is then set to (plus or minus) infinity.

If filter by range is selected, specify the first row number to in/exclude. The end of the range can either be specified by row number, or set to the end of the table, causing all remaining rows to be in/excluded.

If filter by row key is selected, specify a regular expression, which is matched against the row ID of each row. A checkmark can be set, if a case sensitive match should be performed and if the row ID should start with the specified pattern.

ports.dataIn: Datatable from which to filter rows.
ports.dataOut: Datatable with rows meeting the specified criteria
